message.content:
cs.GT, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.IT 

The paper uses game theory to model deception in cyberspace and the Internet of things, which suggests that it belongs to the Game Theory (cs.GT) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of Poisson signaling games to defend against the Mirai botnet, which involves cybersecurity (cs.CR) and information theory (cs.IT). The paper also touches on the difficulty of establishing trust in the Internet of things, which relates to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of quantitative models, which suggests that it could also belong to the Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-category.
